ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I have warned you of a Fire which rages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So, I warn you of the blazing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: I have now warned you of a Blazing Fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I have warned you about the fierce blazing fire
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: I therefore warn you of the fire that is ablaze.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Therefore I have warned you of a Fire Talazza.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore I warn you of the fire that flames:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Now I have warned you of a Fire that flames,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Therefor have I warned you of the flaming Fire
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I have warned you then about a raging Fire:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wherefore have warned you of Fire flaming,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So I warn you of a blazing fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Therefore do I warn you of a Fire blazing fiercely;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Therefore I have warned you of a Fire blazing fiercely (Hell);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: I have now warned you of the Blazing Fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: I have warned you of a Fierce Blaze.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [92:14] So I have warned you of, I have threatened you, O people of Mecca, [with], a raging fire (talazzā, ‘raging’: one of the two original tā’ letters [of tatalazzā] has been omitted; a variant reading retains it, tatalazzā, that is, ‘one that is flaming’),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Therefore have I warned you) of people of Mecca by means of the Qur'an (of the flaming Fire
